Soft clay pack is an item pack containing 100 soft clay. It is obtainable from Prospector Percy's Nugget Shop in the Motherlode Mine for 10 golden nuggets, from Belona's Mining Guild Mineral Exchange for 10 unidentified minerals, or from Dusuri's Star Shop for 150 stardust.

When purchasing clay packs, gold nuggets and minerals are worth 1,640, and stardust is worth 109.33.

The bags are exclusive to the stores they are bought from and therefore cannot be sold to another store in exchange for a different currency.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
8 June 2020
(update | poll)

Soft clay packs are now available from the Mining Guild Mineral Exchange.

9 April 2015
(update)
  • Soft clay packs are no longer tradeable.
  • Golden nugget soft clay packs could no longer be made into banknotes.
20 November 2014
(update)

The item was graphically updated to distinguish between other packs.

22 May 2014
(update)

Golden nugget soft clay packs were made usable by free-to-play players.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Soft clay packs were once tradeable upon release and could be sold to Prospector Percy for golden nuggets, effectively allowing players to buy anything in the shop using coins. This was not widely known or used until achievement diaries were released, where the prospector kit was required for the hard Falador Diary. It was first accepted by Jagex Moderators as an "unforeseen feature"[1], but packs were changed to become untradeable in an update on 9 April 2015.
  • Soft clay packs from Dusuri's Star Shop are the only soft clay packs which are members objects. Soft clay packs from Prospector Percy's Nugget Shop and the Mining Guild Mineral Exchange, although not obtainable in free-to-play, are not considered members objects.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 4 April 2015. (Archived from the original on 5 April 2015.) Mod Ash: "Yes, you can [trade them]. It's not something we'd foreseen, but we've decided to accept it as a feature for now."
